<ce:section-title id="st040">Synthesis of [Eu(tzpya)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>]Cl·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0030" view="all">Htzpya (0.041<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was dissolved in water (1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) and the pH value was adjusted to 3, 4, 5 or 6 with KOH (0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>M), then EuCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.0366<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and ethanol (3.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) were added to the solution, which was sealed in a 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container and heated at 120<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 48<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. After the sample was cooled to room temperature, slow evaporation gave rise to the formation of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>. For <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>, yield: 34% based on Eu<ce:sup loc="post">3+</ce:sup>. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">30</ce:inf>ClEuN<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>: C, 25.36; H, 3.99; N, 18.48. Found: C, 25.03; H, 3.90; N, 18.76%. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3392(s), 1654(m), 1557(w), 1526(w), 1438(w), 1407(m), 1307(w), 1201(w), 1142(w), 1047(w), 694(m), 616(m), 486(m).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st045">Synthesis of [Eu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(atzpa)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>](NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0035" view="all">A similar method to that of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> was adopted to prepare <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> except that Htzpya and EuCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O were replaced by Hatzpa and Eu(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O, respectively. Colorless block crystals <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> were obtained. For <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>, yield: 35% based on Eu<ce:sup loc="post">3+</ce:sup>. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">24</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">26</ce:inf>EuN<ce:inf loc="post">15</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>: C, 34.46; H, 3.13; N, 25.12. Found: C, 34.03; H, 3.20; N, 25.66%. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3365(s), 3208(s), 2365(m), 1666(s), 1592(m), 1486(w), 1451(w), 1401(w), 1339(m), 1229(m), 1108(m), 1014(w), 944(w).</ce:para><ce:section-title id="st050">Synthesis of [Eu(pytza)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>·2<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>3</ce:bold>) and [Eu(pytza)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>·Cl<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>4</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0040" view="all">Hpytza (0.0402<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was dissloved in water (1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) and the pH value was adjusted to approximate 6 with KOH (0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>M), then EuCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.0366<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) or Eu(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.0446<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and ethanol (3.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) were added to the solution, which was sealed in a 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container and heated at 120<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 48<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. Colorless block crystals of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> were obtained. For <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>, yield: 43% based on Eu<ce:sup loc="post">3+</ce:sup>. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">44</ce:inf>Eu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">22</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">24</ce:inf>: C, 15.59; H, 3.60; N, 25.00. Found: C, 14.93; H, 3.44; N, 25.66%. IR (KBr, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3420(s), 1664(s), 1618(s), 1460(m), 1388(s), 1303(m), 820(m), 752(m), 727(m), 699(m), 672(m), 590(m). A similar method to that of compound <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> was adopted to prepare <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> except that pH was adjusted to approximately 3 and EuCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.0366<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was used. Colorless block crystals <ce:bold>4</ce:bold> were obtained. For <ce:bold>4</ce:bold>, yield: 43% based on Eu<ce:sup loc="post">3+</ce:sup>. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>ClEuN<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>: C, 28.78; H, 3.02; N, 20.97. Found: C, 28.03; H, 3.13; N, 20.66%. IR (KBr,cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3420(s), 1664(s), 1618(s), 1460(m), 1388(s), 1303(m), 820(m), 752(m), 727(m), 699(m), 672(m), 590(m).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of [Eu(tzpya)2(H2O)5]Cl⋅4H2O (1)

Htzpya (0.041g, 0.2mmol) was dissolved in water (1.0mL) and the pH value was adjusted to 3, 4, 5 or 6 with KOH (0.2M), then EuCl3⋅6H2O (0.0366g, 0.1mmol) and ethanol (3.0mL) were added to the solution, which was sealed in a 25mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container and heated at 120°C for 48h. After the sample was cooled to room temperature, slow evaporation gave rise to the formation of compound 1. For 1, yield: 34% based on Eu3+. Anal. Calc. for C16H30ClEuN10O13: C, 25.36; H, 3.99; N, 18.48. Found: C, 25.03; H, 3.90; N, 18.76%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3392(s), 1654(m), 1557(w), 1526(w), 1438(w), 1407(m), 1307(w), 1201(w), 1142(w), 1047(w), 694(m), 616(m), 486(m).

Synthesis of [Eu2(atzpa)4(H2O)8](NO3)2⋅2H2O (2)

A similar method to that of compound 1 was adopted to prepare 2 except that Htzpya and EuCl3⋅6H2O were replaced by Hatzpa and Eu(NO3)3⋅6H2O, respectively. Colorless block crystals 2 were obtained. For 2, yield: 35% based on Eu3+. Anal. Calc. for C24H26EuN15O10: C, 34.46; H, 3.13; N, 25.12. Found: C, 34.03; H, 3.20; N, 25.66%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3365(s), 3208(s), 2365(m), 1666(s), 1592(m), 1486(w), 1451(w), 1401(w), 1339(m), 1229(m), 1108(m), 1014(w), 944(w).

Synthesis of [Eu(pytza)3(H2O)2] n ⋅2nH2O (3) and [Eu(pytza)2(H2O)4] n ⋅Cl n  (4)

Hpytza (0.0402g, 0.2mmol) was dissloved in water (1.0mL) and the pH value was adjusted to approximate 6 with KOH (0.2M), then EuCl3⋅6H2O (0.0366g, 0.1mmol) or Eu(NO3)3⋅6H2O (0.0446g, 0.1mmol) and ethanol (3.0mL) were added to the solution, which was sealed in a 25mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container and heated at 120°C for 48h. Colorless block crystals of 3 were obtained. For 3, yield: 43% based on Eu3+. Anal. Calc. for C16H44Eu2N22O24: C, 15.59; H, 3.60; N, 25.00. Found: C, 14.93; H, 3.44; N, 25.66%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3420(s), 1664(s), 1618(s), 1460(m), 1388(s), 1303(m), 820(m), 752(m), 727(m), 699(m), 672(m), 590(m). A similar method to that of compound 3 was adopted to prepare 4 except that pH was adjusted to approximately 3 and EuCl3⋅6H2O (0.0366g, 0.1mmol) was used. Colorless block crystals 4 were obtained. For 4, yield: 43% based on Eu3+. Anal. Calc. for C16H20ClEuN10O8: C, 28.78; H, 3.02; N, 20.97. Found: C, 28.03; H, 3.13; N, 20.66%. IR (KBr,cm-1): 3420(s), 1664(s), 1618(s), 1460(m), 1388(s), 1303(m), 820(m), 752(m), 727(m), 699(m), 672(m), 590(m).
